title: Photograph of letter carrier delivering mail by bicycle

title: Wheeling on Riverside Drive
creator: Harper & Bros., New York, New York, USA
description: A man and woman seated side by side ride a wide bicycle vehicle with two large wheels at either side and a small wheel at the front. The couple appears to be in conversation while riding along the Hudson River, which is visible at left. At right, behind the couple, a man rides a tall pennyfarthing bicycle. Further in the background, another couple rides a bicycle in yet a different style. In the background, at right, a coachman visible behind two horses.
subject: Group; Outside; Leisure; CityScape; Cycling; Recreation
source: Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum Collection Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department
image_alt_text: Historic photograph showing a group of people cycling on a road along Riverside Drive in a bustling city environment.

title: Ordinary Racing Bicycle, 1887
creator: Rudge, Daniel
description: Dan Rudge & Co., of Coventry, England manufactured this Ordinary racing bicycle around 1887. This racing model was undoubtedly sold by their U.S. agents, Stoddard, Lovering & Co., of Boston, Massachusetts. The bicycle was originally owned by Godfrey A. S. Wieners who used it in racing events held by the Manhattan Athletic Club.
subject: Object; History; Racing; Mechanical; High-Wheeler; Track
image_alt_text: A detailed photo of a high-wheel racing bicycle from 1887, displayed in a historical collection.
